meanings.definition: A person who stands, especially as a spectator or witness.
meanings.sent1: The standers cheered loudly at the game.
meanings.sent2: The standers watched the performance with excitement.
meanings.sent3: The standers giggled as they watched the funny show.
meanings.sent4: The standers were like pillars of support in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The standers stood tall, their eyes fixed on the stage.

meanings.definition: A device or structure used for supporting or holding something up.
meanings.sent1: The bookshelf had sturdy standers to keep it steady.
meanings.sent2: The standers of the table were made of strong metal.
meanings.sent3: The standers of the tent held firm against the wind.
meanings.sent4: The standers of the bridge bore the weight of the cars above.
meanings.sent5: The standers of the ladder provided stability for climbing.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is in a particular position or status.
meanings.sent1: The standers in line waited patiently for their turn.
meanings.sent2: The standers at the front of the room had the best view.
meanings.sent3: The standers in the competition were all eager to win.
meanings.sent4: The standers in the group were all leaders in their own right.
meanings.sent5: The standers in the meeting were all attentive and focused.
